Failed.WriteStoreParameterTo: Failed to scribble store parameter(s) on {0}.

Log.XMLLoadedButIsUsingDefaults: Config be loaded, but default values be used for the missin' pieces. Ye can fix this warnin' by savin' the current settings.

Failed.SaveConfigurationToDisk: Failed to stash {Shared/Log/SuperGrateXML} to the plank.

Comment.USMTPath: The path to the USMT treasure chest. (E.g: .\USMT\X64)
Comment.PayloadPath: Local path on the source ship where {Shared/SuperGrate} be usin' USMT from. (E.g: C:\LegendaryPlank)
Comment.MigrationStorePath: The path to the USMT migration store. (E.g: \\ba-share\s$ or .\STORE)
Comment.ScanLoadStateParams: CLI parameters for ScanState.exe and LoadState.exe. (See: https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/deployment/usmt/usmt-command-line-syntax)
Comment.AutoDeleteFromStore: Delete the scallywag from the treasure store after a restore? (Store to treasure chest)
Comment.AutoDeleteFromSource: Delete the scallywag from the source ship after a backup? (Source to store)
Comment.HideBuiltInAccounts: Keep the NT AUTHORITY and NT SERVICE accounts hidden from view?
Comment.HideUnknownSIDs: Avoid listin' unknown accounts in the crew?
Comment.DumpLogHere: Keep a log on paper upon exit. (Leave blank to disable) (E.g: \\ba-share\s$\Logs or .\Logs)
Comment.ULColumns: List of columns to display for the source or store scallywags.
Comment.ULViewMode: User list view mode. (E.g: Large (0) / Small Icon (2), List (3), Details (1), and Tile (4))
Comment.SourceComputer: Default source ship at startin' up.
Comment.DestinationComputer: Default treasure chest at startin' up.
Comment.TabView: Default tab view at startin' up (E.g: Source, Store, or None)
Comment.SecurityProtocol: Security protocol version (Restart required) (E.g: SystemDefault, Ssl3, Tls, Tls11, Tls12, or Tls13)

Failed.GetFolderSize: Failed to measure the size of the treasure chest.

Failed.FindLanguage: Failed to find the pirate dialect.

Failed.WriteErrorToWindow: Failed to share the error message with the crew.
Failed.WriteLogToDisk: Failed to inscribe the log on parchment.

Log.SkippedSIDMissingProfile: Skipped scallywag without a hideout aboard the remote vessel: {0}.
Log.DeletingUserFromTheStore: Throwin' {0} overboard from the treasure store...
Log.UserSuccessfullyDeletedFromTheStore: {0} has been sent to Davy Jones' locker from the treasure store.
Log.CopyingUserDeleteAgentToRemotePC: Copied the scallywag delete agent to the remote vessel {0}...
Log.RemovingUserDeleteAgentFromRemotePC: Tossed the scallywag delete agent overboard from the remote vessel {0}...
Log.StoppingUserDeleteAgentOnRemotePC: Ceasing the scallywag delete agent on {0}...
Log.UserDeleteAgentHasBeenStoppedOn: The scallywag delete agent has been stopped on {0}.
Log.GatheringOSArchitectureOn: Gatherin' the vessel's OS architecture on {0}...
Log.TheOSArchitectureOnIs: The vessel's OS architecture on {0} be {1}.

Failed.ResolveSIDViaWMI: Failed to decipher an SID via WMI.
Failed.ResolveStoreGUID: Failed to decode the Store GUID.
Failed.RetrieveHostnameFrom: Failed to retrieve the vessel's name from {0}.
Failed.ListUsersFrom: Failed to list the crew from {0}.
Failed.ReadSIDFromStoreID: Failed to read the SID from the store ID {0}.
Failed.ReadUserFromStoreID: Failed to read the scallywag from the store ID {0}.
Failed.DeleteUserFromTheStore: Failed to cast away {0} from the treasure store.
Failed.StopUserDeleteAgentOn: Failed to halt the scallywag delete agent on {0}.
Failed.GatherOSArchitectureOn: Failed to gather the vessel's OS architecture on {0}.

Failed.WaitForRemoteProcess: Failed to wait for the distant process {0} to finish.

Log.UserWillBeAppliedAs: User {0} be set to be applied as {1}.

Failed.FindUSMTFolderAt: Failed to find USMT folder at {0}.
Failed.DeleteUSMTAttempt: Failed to delete USMT, the process may still be runnin', tryin' periodically: Attempt {0}/{1}.
Failed.GenerateMUParameter: Failed to generate MU parameter for USMT.
Failed.TransferUserStateTo: Failed to transfer user's state to {0}.
Failed.DownloadUSMT: Failed to automatically download USMT from the web, please download USMT and update the {Shared/Log/SuperGrateXML} accordingly.
Failed.OSArchitectureIsNotSupported: The OS architecture {0} be not supported.
Failed.WatchRemoteLog: Failed to watch remote log scroll at {0}.
Failed.NotEnoughDiskSpace: Arrr! Can't finish USMT, there be not enough space in the ship's hold on the source or destination vessel. Give "SuperGratePayloadPath" a tweak in the settings, point it to an external chest o' gold connected to the source or destination vessel, ye scallywag!
Failed.ErrorProcessingCLI: Walk the plank, USMT can't set sail! The values in the "ScanStateParameters" or "LoadStateParameters" be like a rickety old dinghy, not seaworthy at all.
Failed.WindowsServerIsNotSupported: Hoist the Jolly Roger! USMT can't set sail on Windows Server seas, matey! That ship ain't in these waters!
Failed.UnknownError: Blimey! USMT can't set sail or drop anchor, aye, an unknown tempest be brewin'.

Failed.QueryWMI: Failed to query WMI, {0} might have a cursed WMI setup. Try to run the command "winmgmt.exe /resetrepository" on the target ship to mend this issue. https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/wmisdk/winmgmt
Failed.ConnectToViaWMI: Failed to connect to {0} via WMI. Make sure the distant vessel be online.
Failed.ConnectToViaWMIAccessDenied: Failed to connect to {0} via WMI because access be denied. Make sure yer pirate account has the authority to steer the distant vessel.

Failed.SearchActiveDirectory: Failed to scour the Active Directory.

RenameStoreUser.UseThisDialog: Use this dialogue to provide a "new alias" when restoring a profile from the "treasure store"

Log.SavingDataToMigrationStore: Saving the scallywag's data to the treasure store...

Settings.DoubleClickToChangeValue: Double click to Alter the Bearings

Main.AreYouSureScuttleUsers: Be ye sure ye want to scuttle these {0} scallywags?
